page.title: 14TRANSPORT, GRAINTHORPE
page.content: When I was a boy the only method of transport was by horse and cart. There were a few motors but if you wanted anything,you got it by a Carriers Cart that went to Louth or Grimsby,two or three times a week. This heralded the start of the first bus services. The main road's surface was dusty and the side roads were terrible. They were re-surfaced by gangs of men spraying hot tar and scattering stone chippings,flattened by a steam-roller. Carts were usually made in the village by the carpenter and wheelwright. Accidents weren't as likely to happen then as nowadays,and even if a horse ranaway it wasn't usually very serious. Nowadays even though there is a daily bus service to Grimsby you really need your own car.
